clinical_study.brief_title: Karydakis Procedure Vs Limberg Flap in Treatment of Sacrococcygeal Pilonidal Sinus
clinical_study.official_title: Karydakis Procedure Vs Limberg Flap in Treatment of Sacrococcygeal Pilonidal Sinus

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be a randomized controlled trial in which there will be comparison of the effectiveness of Karydakis procedure and Limberg flap in treatment of sacrococcygeal pilonidal sinus

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients presenting with recurrence of pilonidal sinus
primary_outcome.description: Recurrence of Pilonidal Sinus(described as appearance of multiple discharging sinuses in operative site) after surgical procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of weeks in which the operative wound will be healed
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of wound healing (complete epithelization of wound )

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of patients developing postoperative pain
secondary_outcome.description: postoperative pain( measured by visual analog score with 1 being minimum score and 10 being maximum score) after surgery

arm_group.description: Karydakis Procedure: In this procedure the pilonidal sinus will be excised by semilunar incision so that the incision line closure will be away from midline.
Limberg Flap: In this procedure the pilonidal sinus will be excised by diamond shaped incision and the defect will be closed by random pattern flap.

intervention.description: Pilonidal sinus will be excised by Karydakis procedure
Pilonidal sinus will be excised by Limberg Flap

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with pilonidal sinus of any sex and aged 20 years or above
- Non infected pilonidal sinus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infected pilonidal sinus
- Uncontrolled diabetes
- Patient on immunosuppressive therapy
